meta.title: Comprehensive Chess ECO Opening Database
meta.description: Complete database of chess openings organized by ECO codes A00-E99

A.name: Polish Opening
A.description: The Polish Opening is an irregular flank opening starting with b4, aiming to control the dark squares and create early imbalance.

A.name: Grob Attack
A.description: The Grob Attack is a highly irregular opening starting with g4, creating immediate kingside weakness but surprise value.

A.name: Anderssen Opening
A.description: The Anderssen Opening begins with a3, a very slow and passive move that offers little to White.

A.name: Durkin Opening
A.description: The Durkin Opening starts with Na3, developing the knight to a poor square.

A.name: Nimzovich-Larsen Attack
A.description: The Nimzovich-Larsen Attack starts with b3, fianchettoing the bishop to control the long diagonal.

A.name: Bird Opening
A.description: The Bird Opening starts with f4, controlling the e5 square and preparing a kingside pawn storm.

A.name: Bird Opening: Dutch Variation
A.description: Bird Opening with Black's immediate central response d5.

A.name: Réti Opening
A.description: The Réti Opening begins with Nf3, a flexible move that can transpose into many different openings.

A.name: Réti Opening: Nimzowitsch-Larsen Attack
A.description: Réti Opening with Black playing Nf6, leading to flexible development.

A.name: Réti Opening: 1...d5
A.description: Réti Opening with Black occupying the center with d5.

A.name: King's Indian Attack
A.description: The King's Indian Attack setup with g3, preparing to fianchetto the bishop.

A.name: King's Indian Attack: Fianchetto Variation
A.description: King's Indian Attack with the fianchettoed bishop on g2.

A.name: Réti Opening: Advance Variation
A.description: Réti Opening transposing to English with c4.

A.name: English Opening
A.description: The English Opening starts with c4, controlling the d5 square and allowing for flexible development.

A.name: English Opening: Caro-Kann Defensive System
A.description: English Opening with Black adopting a Caro-Kann setup.

A.name: English Opening: London Defensive System
A.description: English Opening with Black setting up a London System defense.
A.pgn: 1. c4 c6 2. Nf3 d5 3. b3 Bf5

A.name: English Opening: Agincourt Defense
A.description: English Opening with Black playing the Agincourt Defense with e6.

A.name: English Opening: Neo-Catalan
A.description: English Opening developing into a Neo-Catalan structure.
A.pgn: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. g3 Nf6 4. Bg2

A.name: English Opening: Anglo-Indian Defense
A.description: English Opening with Black adopting an Indian Defense setup.

variations.name: Queen's Indian Formation
variations.pgn: 1. c4 Nf6 2. Nc3 e6 3. Nf3 b6

A.name: English Opening: Anglo-Indian Defense, Queen's Knight Variation
A.description: Anglo-Indian Defense with early development of the queen's knight.

A.name: English Opening: Queens Gambit Formation
A.description: English Opening transposing to Queen's Gambit structures.

A.name: English Opening: Mikenas-Carls, Flohr Variation
A.description: English Opening with the Flohr Variation in the Mikenas-Carls system.

A.name: English Opening: Mikenas-Carls, Sicilian Variation
A.description: English Opening with Sicilian Defense characteristics.
A.pgn: 1. c4 Nf6 2. Nc3 e6 3. e4 c5

A.name: English Opening: King's English Variation
A.description: English Opening with Black responding with e5, creating a reversed Sicilian.

A.name: English Opening: King's English Variation, Reversed Sicilian
A.description: King's English with development leading to a reversed Sicilian structure.

A.description: King's English with both sides developing knights early.

A.description: King's English developing into a closed system.

A.description: King's English with full symmetrical development.

B.name: King's Pawn Opening
B.description: King's Pawn opening where Black does not respond with the main defenses (e5, d5, Nf6, c5, c6, e6).

B.name: Scandinavian Defense
B.description: The Scandinavian Defense is Black's most direct counter to e4, immediately challenging White's center pawn.

variations.name: Main Line
variations.pgn: 1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qa5

variations.name: Gubinsky-Melts Defense
variations.pgn: 1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qd6

B.name: Alekhine Defense
B.description: The Alekhine Defense provokes White's pawns to advance, with the idea of later attacking the overextended center.

B.description: Alekhine Defense with White playing d4 and developing the center.

B.name: Modern Defense
B.description: The Modern Defense is a hypermodern opening where Black fianchettoes the king's bishop and delays central pawn advances.

variations.pgn: 1. e4 g6 2. Bc4 Bg7 3. Qf3 e6 4. d4 Bxd4

B.name: Caro-Kann Defense
B.description: The Caro-Kann Defense is a solid opening that leads to good endgame prospects for Black with a sound pawn structure.
